title: Ravenshade Manor
description: A haunting interactive horror story set in the abandoned Ravenshade Manor on Halloween night. Every choice may be your last.

pages.text: Halloween night. You find the ancient gate afar. Beyond, Ravenshade Manor stands dark, a flicker of light in a window is seen. Your phone dies suddenly.

options.text: Circle around the house to the back

pages.text: As you approach. Silence presses in. The air smells faintly of smoke and something old.
Around back, moonlight reveals strange symbols carved into the walls. A faint noise comes from the basement door.

options.text: Trace the symbols on the wall

pages.text: Your voice fades quickly. No answer, but faint footsteps echo from the woods nearby.
Inside, shadows cling to the walls. A faint melody plays from somewhere unseen, slow and haunting.
Your knocking echoes, but no response.
Waiting only deepens the silence. Suddenly your heart races as a whisper moves past your ear. Unnoticeable but sudden.
The basement door creaks as it opens. Darkness covers everything; faint breathing noises from within.

options.text: Shut the door and step away

pages.text: The symbols glow faintly under your touch. The ground trembles. The walls seem to pulse like a heartbeat.
Following the footsteps leads to a clearing with a broken doll half-buried in leaves. A chill runs through your spine.
You crouch as shadows dance in the moonlit forest. Eyes appear briefly, watching.
The melody draws you to an old piano. Keys press down themselves in a slow, chilling tune.
The hallway narrows, the walls moist and smelling of earth. Drops of water echo somewhere ahead.
Upstairs, doors creak under a cold breath trembling the wood. You hear a child's laughter faintly.
Windows rattle, but none will open. The house settles with a low groan.
Listening carefully, you hear faint scratching from inside the walls.
You whirl but see only empty air. Yet the hair on your neck rises as a cold hand brushes past.
You escape the manor grounds, heart pounding. The gate slams shut behind you. You are safe, for now.
The basement stairs creak under faint footsteps. Darkness nearly swallows you whole.
The garden path twists, the air thickens. A distant bell tolls—somewhere beyond the trees.
The doll’s button eyes seem to glint. Touching it makes faint giggling fill the air.
You wait as the forest falls into silence. Then a distant scream shatters the calm.
The attic door creaks open meagerly to a frozen room filled with dust and cobwebs. Something moves in the corner.
